Realized the truth when I saw the black cat during the arrest

title: Me
surface: Mom died, I cried. Dad died, I smiled. Grandma died, I went crazy.
bottom: Dad often abused Mom and me, and Mom often abused me. Only Grandma loved me in this family. I couldn't stand their abuse anymore and decided to fight back. One day, Dad was on a business trip, and I seized the opportunity to kill Mom. At the mourning hall, I pretended to cry sadly, but my heart was blooming with joy. Grandma knew Mom was dead and, remembering Dad's frequent abuse of Mom, thought Dad had killed Mom. In a fit of emotion at the mourning hall, she killed Dad. I smiled. The police were also present, and seeing Grandma kill Dad, they assumed Grandma had also killed Mom and executed her. I lost the only person in the world who loved me, and I went crazy.
tips: I killed my mother due to domestic abuse
Grandma misunderstood and killed father to avenge mother
My emotional reactions to death are based on affection and hatred
Grandma was mistakenly judged a serial killer and executed
Losing the only caregiver led to the narrator's mental breakdown

title: Who Killed Me
surface: Dad starved me, Mom pricked me with needles, only my sister loved me. So who killed me?
bottom: I suffered from congenital diabetes. Dad didn't let me eat high-calorie foods, and Mom gave me insulin injections every day. To treat my illness, our family was already deeply in debt, and our meager life meant my sister couldn't afford anything she wanted. She hated me, this burden, so my sister often secretly bought me snacks, which led to my death from diabetic complications.
tips: I suffered from severe diabetes
Parents' actions were necessary medical measures
Sister's "love" was actually harmful behavior
Forbidden snacks led to worsening condition and death
Sister is the ultimate perpetrator

title: Note
surface: A girl returned home to find her mother dead, her father haggard. In a pool of blood nearby were several torn pieces of paper. The girl then discovered the torn note, which read: "Daughter, quick, leave, Dad, crazy!!"
bottom: The daughter had mental problems; she killed her mother. The note was written by the mother, but it was torn, so the words were jumbled. The real reading was "Dad, quick, leave, daughter is crazy."
tips: The daughter is the murderer of the mother
The note fragments were disordered, leading to misinterpretation
The note was a warning from the mother to the father
The daughter suffers from a mental illness
The father is haggard from witnessing the tragedy

title: Her Lie
surface: Hearing my daughter's voice, I was terrified. Then I quietly thought about how to punish her for lying.
bottom: When I recognized my daughter's voice on the other end of the suicide prevention hotline, I was terrified. I quietly listened to her shouting, crying, and accusing her abusive mother, and began to think about how to punish the bad child who lied, as she had clearly promised not to tell anyone.
tips: I am a suicide prevention hotline operator
The daughter called the hotline to accuse her mother of abuse
I am the abusive mother being accused
"Lying" refers to the daughter breaking her promise to expose domestic violence
The narrator's fear stems from the secret being revealed

title: Frantic Knocking
surface: The person outside frantically knocked on the door; he ignored it. He heard a hammer smashing the door, and soon after, screams came from outside the door.
bottom: He was a pilot suffering from depression. The doctor diagnosed his depression and reported it to the airline, hoping he would be grounded, but the company didn't care. One day on a civilian flight, he told the co-pilot to go to the restroom, sending him away. It was already the cruising phase, which should have been very safe. When the co-pilot returned, he found the cockpit door locked. He frantically knocked, but the pilot inside was unmoved. He started smashing the door, but airplane doors are very strong. Passengers gradually understood what was happening, and at the moment of impact with the mountain, the black box recorded the screams of all passengers.
tips: The story takes place inside an airplane cockpit
The person inside the door is the pilot who intentionally locked it
The person outside the door is the co-pilot trying to enter
The pilot suffered from depression and was ignored
The final screams came from the plane crash

title: Wife
surface: "Your wife is so young and beautiful." They smiled. "Your wife is so young and beautiful." He smiled.
bottom: The man's wife was young and beautiful, and he always received compliments when he took her out. Both husband and wife were very happy. Later, his wife gradually aged, developing wrinkles and loose skin. The man heard fewer and fewer compliments and envious remarks. So, he pulled his wife's facial skin tight and stitched it up behind her head, making her appear perpetually young and beautiful. "Your wife is so young and beautiful." He finally heard compliments again and smiled happily. But his wife, enduring the pain and tightness of her facial skin, could no longer smile.
tips: The wife's youthfulness is an artificially maintained illusion
The husband achieved "youth" by stitching his wife's facial skin
The husband's motive was to gain others' praise
"They" refers to the couple, "he" refers to the husband
The wife could not smile due to her facial skin being pulled tight

title: It's Dark
surface: Don't come to my house when it's dark. At eight, Mom hides under the bed. At nine, Dad drags you to drink. At ten, Sister gets up; she doesn't like you much. You're really unlucky.
bottom:
Dad was a hopeless alcoholic. When he got drunk, he would beat everyone in the family. Mom could only hug me and my sister and hide under the bed. Until Dad accidentally killed Mom. Sister, to protect me, killed Dad and was taken away by the police.
The huge psychological trauma caused me to develop multiple personalities. I told my boyfriend not to come to my house when it's dark, but he still came. At eight o'clock, the Mom personality hid under the bed; at nine o'clock, the Dad personality dragged him to drink; at ten o'clock, the Sister personality woke up, saw the drunk boyfriend, thought he was like Dad, and, afraid I would repeat the same mistakes, killed him.
tips: The narrator suffers from severe mental problems due to past family tragedy.
The narrator exhibits different personalities of deceased family members.
These personalities emerge and act at specific times during the night.
The visitor came to the narrator's house at night despite warnings.
The visitor was ultimately killed by one of the narrator's personalities.

title: Favoritism
surface: Mom made me a big table of delicious food and even set out bowls and chopsticks for me, but Mom died. Mom died, and my sister died too.
bottom: My younger sister developed a heart problem the day after tomorrow. Because Mom favored my sister, she wanted to use my heart to save my sister's life, so she poisoned my bowl. I guessed Mom's intention, and when she wasn't looking, I swapped the poisoned bowl. Mom accidentally ate it, and so Mom died. My sister also died because her heart wasn't replaced.
tips: The younger sister suffered from a life-threatening illness.
The food prepared by the mother contained something lethal.
The mother intended to kill the narrator to save the younger sister.
The narrator took a crucial action before the meal.
The mother and sister died in different ways.

title: Pregnant
surface: I'm pregnant... but ever since my sister came to my house, I'm the only one left in the house.
bottom: My husband and I were very much in love. Shortly after we got married, I became pregnant. We finally had our first child, but I developed postpartum depression because of it. My mental state got worse and worse, and I had a strong lack of security. I imagined my child as my 'sister'. I saw that whenever the 'sister' cried, my husband would rush to comfort her, and even when the 'sister' ate, my husband had to feed her. I felt very angry and jealous. Why should my husband care so much for this 'sister'? He said he would only love me in his life. Overwhelmed by anger and jealousy, I killed both of them in a fit of rage.
tips: The narrator recently gave birth to a child.
The narrator's mental state became unstable after childbirth.
The 'sister' mentioned in the story actually refers to the baby.
The narrator misunderstood and became jealous of her husband's care for the baby.
The other people in the house were killed by the narrator.

title: Milk
surface:
Sister drank the milk and died,
Dad threw away the milk and also died
I died, Mom smiled.
bottom: Dad fell in love with someone else, but after several attempts to test the waters, he found out Mom wouldn't agree to a divorce, so he poisoned Mom's milk. Sister didn't know the milk was poisoned and died after drinking it. To destroy the evidence, Dad threw away the remaining milk. Mom noticed Dad's strange behavior and knew he originally intended to poison her, so she killed Dad while he was asleep. After Dad and Sister died, Mom focused all her energy on me, becoming extremely strict with me. If I didn't do well, she would abuse me and gaslight me. Gradually, I couldn't bear it anymore and chose to end my own life. Mom lost all her relatives, her brain suffered a shock, and she became insane, sitting on the balcony every day, smiling foolishly.
tips: Milk was the key item that caused death.
The sister was accidentally killed by the father.
The mother smiled because she had mental problems.
The mother killed the father.
The narrator's death is related to the mother's behavior after other family members died.

title: Brother
surface: Brother's face was injured, I was extremely angry! At night, an identical wound appeared on my face. Drip, drip. From then on, brother will never be injured again.
bottom: My brother and I are twins, we look exactly alike, and our personalities and hobbies are also the same. But we both extremely disliked the existence of such a similar person in the world, so we jointly decided to let one 'completely disappear' and live under one identity from then on, so that in the eyes of others, we would be 'the only one.' We agreed to go out one day at a time. This day, my brother came back with an intentional injury on his face. I was very angry! If I wanted to go out tomorrow, I would have to make an identical wound on my face in the same place, otherwise I would have to stay at home until his wound healed. At night, after my brother fell asleep, I compared and made the same wound on my face. Blood dripped from the tip of the knife onto my brother, drip, drip. I aimed the tip of the knife at my brother's heart and plunged it in. From now on, I am the real 'only one,' and my brother will never need to intentionally injure himself again.
tips: The narrator and his brother are identical twins.
They agreed to take turns playing the same person.
The injury on the brother's face was intentional.
The narrator replicated the wound on his own face.
The narrator killed his brother.

title: Hospital
surface: I got sick and went to the hospital. Soon after, my sister died. Why?
bottom: I am congenitally intellectually disabled. When I was a child, I saw on TV that woodpeckers tap tree trunks to determine if there are insects inside. Recently, my mother took me to the hospital because of a stomachache. The doctor said I ate something unclean and had parasites in my stomach. Later, one day when my sister and I were at home, she suddenly cried out from a stomachache. I thought she also had worms in her stomach, so I imitated the woodpecker's method, found a tool, and chiseled at my sister's stomach trying to find the worms. As a result, my sister died.
tips: The narrator has intellectual disabilities.
The narrator recently went to the hospital due to parasites in their stomach.
The narrator imitated a certain animal behavior seen on TV.
The sister and the narrator experienced similar physical discomfort (stomachache).
The narrator inflicted physical harm on the sister.

title: Different Eyes
surface: I grew up in an orphanage. The children were all afraid of me, but a woman wanted to raise me. I thought she loved me very much, until I saw what was in the room.
bottom: I grew up in an orphanage. They were afraid of me because I said I could see ghosts. But a woman took a liking to me. She was very good to me, and I treated her like a mother, until one day I saw a room full of posthumous photos of another girl. It turned out she didn't really want to adopt me, but wanted to use my eyes to see her daughter, but I had deceived her.
tips: The narrator claims to have special abilities (can see ghosts).
The woman who adopted the narrator has a deceased child.

title: Spitting out Medicine
surface: My wife always makes me take my medicine on time. Although I love my wife very much, I secretly spit out the medicine.
bottom: My wife is already dead, the cause of death was a car accident. I developed a mental illness due to excessive grief. I secretly spit out the medicine so that I can fantasize that my wife is by my side. If I take the psychiatric medication, the fantasized wife disappears. (To prevent my wife from disappearing, I always secretly spit out the medicine; this way, the fantasized wife stays with me).
tips: The wife's true state is inconsistent with what is apparent in the story.
The narrator suffers from a mental illness.

Spitting out the medicine is to maintain a certain status quo.

title: The Porridge He Cooked
surface: Ding-ling-ling... (phone alarm) People on the street looked at me in horror. I saw blood on my hands. I thought I would never be able to drink the porridge he cooked again.
bottom: He is my boyfriend, we are very much in love, and recently decided to move in together. He is very good to me, usually makes me delicious food, his cooking skills are really good, and I love the fish congee he makes for me the most. But I have a secret I never told him, which is that I have somnambulism (sleepwalking). This night, I forgot to take the medicine for sleepwalking. In my sleep, I dreamed that he was working overtime at the company, and I also wanted to make a bowl of delicious fish congee to send to him as a late-night snack. I followed his method to prepare the fish, chopped off the fish head, gutted the fish, removed the internal organs, sliced the fish, and then put it in the congee to simmer... After it was done, I tasted it, and the flavor was truly unprecedentedly delicious, he would definitely praise my cooking skills! I immediately packed the congee and happily went out to deliver it to him. I was walking on the street thinking about how he would praise me, and then the alarm clock rang. Suddenly the scene changed from night to early morning, the lunch box in my hand disappeared, and only the shocking bloodstains on my hands appeared vaguely... Everyone on the street stared wide-eyed, looking at me covered in blood as if they had seen a ghost. I think, yesterday I probably used him, to cook the congee. I think, I will never be able to drink the porridge he cooked again...
tips: The narrator suffers from somnambulism (sleepwalking) and did not take medication that night.
The narrator killed her boyfriend.
The narrator imitated the process of making congee while sleepwalking.
The next morning, the narrator woke up on the street, covered in blood.
The boyfriend's death is related to the 'congee-making' behavior during sleepwalking.

title: Home
surface: After the cactus at home withered, I took my younger brother to see a waterfall. Later, Mom's flower also died.
bottom: Mom favored my younger brother, indulged him exceptionally, and cherished him like a flower in the palm of her hand. Even when my younger brother deliberately poured boiling water on my most beloved cactus and killed it, Mom just said: 'Forget it, forget it, he's still just a child.' I was very angry and jealous, so I poured a basin of scalding boiling water over my younger brother's head. The scalding water steamed, like a cascading waterfall. It's great, now Mom's flower is dead too.
tips: The cactus was deliberately killed by the younger brother.
The way the younger brother was killed is related to the way the younger brother killed the cactus.
Mom favored the younger brother very much, which caused the narrator's dissatisfaction.
'Waterfall' does not refer to a natural landscape.

title: Small Shop
surface: New Year is approaching. Mom has been acting strangely lately, but Dad is all smiles. I swapped their positions. Business came, the customer screamed, Dad went mad, and Mom cherished me especially.
bottom:
Our family runs a small shop selling noodles. New Year is approaching, and everywhere is festive. Mom just gave birth to my younger brother, and Dad is especially happy. But Mom, suffering from postpartum depression, has been behaving strangely, almost erratically.
I was afraid the newborn baby would take away Mom and Dad's affection, so I swapped my baby brother in the cradle with the meat on the chopping block. Soon, a customer came. He wanted to buy dumpling wrappers for the New Year and asked Mom to grind the dumpling meat filling. Mom, not in her right mind, directly stuffed my brother from the chopping block into the meat grinder. Flesh and blood splattered everywhere; the customer screamed in terror.
Dad, upon discovering this, went mad. From then on, they only had me as their child, and Mom cherished me especially.
tips: This family's business is related to food processing.
The mother has just given birth and is mentally unstable.
The narrator feels insecure because of the newborn younger brother.
The narrator swapped the baby with ingredients ready for processing.
The baby's manner of death is related to the food processing procedure.

title: Game
surface: Let's play a game. You play the adult, I'll pretend to be the lover. Only good people will be left.
bottom:
My dad was abusive. Mom died protecting me. I hate him. Next door lived a mother and daughter; the girl was much younger than me. Once, I followed Dad and found him secretly assaulting the girl, while the girl's mother watched coldly. So I found the girl and learned from her that her mother, after divorcing, had a chaotic private life and especially favored young men. So we conspired to avenge each other. She wore sexy clothes to seduce Dad, and I took the opportunity to kill Dad. I wore youthful clothes to seduce her mother, creating an opportunity for her to kill her mother.
Finally, all the bad people were killed by us. Only good people were left.
tips: The narrator and another girl were both victims of domestic violence.
Their abusers were elders in their respective families.
'Playing the adult' and 'pretending to be the lover' were part of their revenge plan.
They cooperated to create opportunities for each other to commit murder.
The 'good people' left at the end refer to the narrator and the neighbor girl.

title: Notebook
surface: I am a detective, recently investigating a case. Today, there was a major breakthrough in the case; I found a notebook. Suddenly, my expression changed dramatically.
bottom: I have dissociative identity disorder, but I personally don't know it. After my whole family was murdered, I resolved to become a detective to avenge them. Recently, I was investigating a case; the victim looked a lot like my sister, and I swore to find the killer. Finally, I found a notebook. After opening it, I found the handwriting familiar. After reading it, I was about to record important clues when I suddenly realized it was my handwriting. Recalling the contents of the notebook, I gave a bitter laugh. It turned out I had dissociative identity disorder and had wiped out my own family. And all of this was 'my' (the other personality's) plan; he wanted to become the dominant personality. Utterly dejected, I sought my own death.
tips: The case the narrator is investigating is the murder of his own family.
The key piece of evidence is a notebook.
The handwriting in the notebook is identical to the narrator's own handwriting.
The narrator suffers from a severe mental illness, but is unaware of it.
The notebook reveals that the narrator himself is the murderer of his family.

title: Necklace
surface: I wore my sister's necklace and survived because of it.
bottom: Because my sister and I are twins, we look very much alike. So Mom, to distinguish us, gave us different necklaces. But I gradually discovered that Mom was actually using it to better favor my sister. So I found an excuse to exchange necklaces with my sister, then pushed her into the water, and jumped in myself, crying for help. I knew Mom would definitely save 'sister'.
tips: The narrator and her sister are identical twins.
The necklace is the key item to distinguish their identities.
The mother treated the two children differently.
Before the incident, the narrator and her sister had exchanged necklaces.
Survival was directly related to which necklace was worn.
